abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, high institutional
            development impacts, and satisfactory performances by the
            Bank and Borrower. Lessons once again reinforce the
            importance of a strong political commitment to the reform
            agenda, to include as well, an understanding that public
            sector reform is a long-term process in the reform effort.
            Lessons of experience also point at Project sustainability,
            which is highly dependant on the level of training and
            knowledge derived during project implementation, leading to
            a Government fiscal capacity, able to retain trained staff,
            and internalize project capabilities within permanent
            institutions. As institutional reform usually requires
            passage of legislation, commitment at the highest political
            level is needed. Linkage to policy lending instruments - as
            this operation had - can constitute an essential element to
            provide the leverage, and incentives to undertake the
            reforms that are being supported.
